Module Reference¶

quality.py¶

Quality and region-based analysis utilities.

Functions for measuring brightness variability, nuclei under membrane, and related metrics.

czbi_da_parez.processing.quality.count_nuclei_under_membrane(nuclei_labels, membrane_mask)¶

Counts the number of nuclei under the membrane.

Parameters:

  • nuclei_labels – Labeled nuclei image.

  • membrane_mask – Binary mask of the membrane.

Returns:

Number of nuclei under the membrane.

Return type:

int

czbi_da_parez.processing.quality.measure_brightness_variability(intensity_image, mask)¶

Measures the variability of brightness values under a mask.

Parameters:

  • intensity_image – The image containing brightness values.

  • mask – A binary mask where 1 indicates the region of interest.

Returns:

Brightness variability metrics (e.g., standard deviation).

Return type:

dict

czbi_da_parez.processing.quality.percentage_nuclei_pixels(nuclei_labels, membrane_mask)¶

Calculates the percentage of nuclei pixels within the membrane.

Parameters:

  • nuclei_labels – Labeled nuclei image.

  • membrane_mask – Binary mask of the membrane.

Returns:

Percentage of nuclei pixels within the membrane.

Return type:

float

image_channel_analysis.py¶

Image channel analysis and mask extraction utilities.

Module-level functions for image channel analysis and mask extraction. All functions are at the module level for Sphinx compatibility and batch workflows.

czbi_da_parez.processing.image_channel_analysis.image_info(image_path)¶

Get image size and number of channels.

Parameters:

image_path (str) – Path to the image file.

Returns:

Image size and number of channels.

Return type:

tuple

czbi_da_parez.processing.image_channel_analysis.image_th_ch1(image)¶

Processes channel 1 of the image using StarDist2D model.

Parameters:

image – The input image.

Returns:

Labeled image, None, and binary mask.

Return type:

tuple

czbi_da_parez.processing.image_channel_analysis.image_th_ch2(image)¶

Processes channel 2 of the image using Gaussian blur and Otsu thresholding.

Parameters:

image – The input image.

Returns:

Labeled image, blurred image, and thresholded image.

Return type:

tuple

czbi_da_parez.processing.image_channel_analysis.normalize(image)¶

Normalizes the image intensity to the range [0, 1].

czbi_da_parez.processing.image_channel_analysis.plot_normalized_channels(channel_1, channel_2)¶

Plots the normalized channels.

Parameters:

  • channel_1 – The first image channel (e.g., nuclei).

  • channel_2 – The second image channel (e.g., membrane).

ipynb_helper.py¶

Helper functions for working with Jupyter Notebooks.

Classes:

NotebookConverter: Provides methods for converting notebooks to Python scripts.

class czbi_da_parez.utilities.ipynb_helper.NotebookConverter¶

Bases: object

Provides methods for converting Jupyter Notebooks to Python scripts.

static convert_ipynb_to_py(ipynb_file: str, py_file: str) → None¶

Convert a Jupyter Notebook (.ipynb) file to a Python (.py) script.

Parameters:

  • ipynb_file (str) – The path to the input .ipynb file.

  • py_file (str) – The path to the output .py file.

ipynb_todo_check.py¶

Utilities for finding TODOs in Jupyter Notebooks.

Classes:

NotebookTodoChecker: Provides methods for finding and summarizing TODOs in notebooks.

class czbi_da_parez.utilities.ipynb_todo_check.NotebookTodoChecker¶

Bases: object

Provides methods for finding and summarizing TODOs in Jupyter Notebooks.

static find_todos_in_notebook(notebook_content: dict) → None¶

Finds and summarizes TODOs in a Jupyter Notebook’s text and code cells.

Parameters:

notebook_content (dict) – The notebook content as a dictionary.

static ipynb_todo_check(path: str, notebook_name: str) → None¶

Reads a Jupyter Notebook file and checks for TODOs in its cells.

Parameters:

  • path (str) – Path to the folder containing the notebook.

  • notebook_name (str) – Name of the notebook file.
